DisplayString.Name: Network Management Reports
DisplayString.Description: This Management Pack contains reports for network management.

DisplayString.Name: Interface Traffic Volume
DisplayString.Description: This report displays the rate of inbound and outbound traffic that goes through the selected port or interface over time.

DisplayString.Name: Interface Error Packet Analysis
DisplayString.Description: This report displays the percentage of error packets or discarded packets, both inbound and outbound, for the selected port or interface.

DisplayString.Name: Memory Utilization
DisplayString.Description: This report displays the percentage of free memory on a particular network device over a period of time.

DisplayString.Name: Processor Utilization
DisplayString.Description: This report displays the processor utilization of a particular network device over a period of time.

DisplayString.Name: Interface Packet Analysis
DisplayString.Description: This report display the types of packets (unicast or nonunicast) that traverse the selected port or interface.

DisplayString.Name: Custom Performance
DisplayString.Description: This report displays performance counter values.

DisplayString.Name: This report display the rate of inbound and outbound traffic that goes through the selected port or interface over time.
This report display the types of packets (unicast or nonunicast) that traverse the selected port or interface.
This report display the types of error packets that traverse the selected port or interface.
This report displays the process utilization of a particular network device over a period of time.
This report displays the percentage of free memory on a particular network device over a period of time.

maml:section.maml:title: Summary
maml:section.maml:para: Microsoft System Center Network Management Reports MP: This management pack provides reports for network management.

maml:section.maml:title: Summary
maml:section.maml:para: This report displays the rate of inbound and outbound traffic that goes through the selected port or interface over time.
Description:
The report shows the volume of traffic in bits that traverses the specified interface over time. Note that the traffic is measured in bits, not bytes.
Parameters:
Date/Time Selection: allows defining a time period for the report with relative or fixed dates
Business hours: Allows defining one business hours time range and the weekdays it applies to. If business hours are defined this report only reports within this range.
Histogram: Allows selecting the values used for the x-axis of the report.

maml:entry.maml:para: Daily by hours
For the chosen time range the x-axis will be one day.
Every x-axis unit is an hour.
To be able to show this histogram the values for the same hour are averaged.
Weekly by weekdays
One week is the time range of the x-axis.
Every unit is a weekday.
Monthly by days
One month is the x-axis time range.
Every unit is a numeric day of the month
Yearly by month
A year is the time range of the x-axis.
Every unit is a month.

maml:section.maml:para: Default is no (which is a historical chart)
3D Chart: Allows choosing if the report is shown in a flat or a 3D image.
Units: Allows the operator to set the scale for the Y-axis:

maml:entry.maml:para: Bits per second (bps)
Kilobits per second (kbps)
Megabits per second (Mbps)
Gigabits per second (Gbps)

maml:section.maml:para: Object List:
This report expects objects of type Port and/or Interface.
It is also possible to use the "Add Group" button and provide a group or a network device. The report will then display the average value for all objects in the group or from the network device.

maml:section.maml:title: Summary
maml:section.maml:para: This report shows the percentage of packets that are in error or discarded, inbound and outbound, on the adapter.
Description:
This report shows the percentage of packets of different types that traverse the interface. It shows packets that are either in error or discarded, both inbound and outbound, on the adapter.
Parameters:
Date/Time Selection: allows defining a time period for the report with relative or fixed dates
Business hours: Allows defining one business hours time range and the weekdays it applies to. If business hours are defined this report only reports within this range.
Histogram: Allows selecting the values used for the x-axis of the report.

maml:entry.maml:para: Daily by hours
For the chosen time range the x-axis will be one day.
Every x-axis unit is an hour.
To be able to show this histogram the values for the same hour are averaged.
Weekly by weekdays
One week is the time range of the x-axis.
Every unit is a weekday.
Monthly by days
One month is the x-axis time range.
Every unit is a numeric day of the month
Yearly by month
A year is the time range of the x-axis.
Every unit is a month.

maml:section.maml:para: Default is no (which is a historical chart)
3D Chart: Allows choosing if the report is shown in a flat or a 3D image.
Object List:
This report expects objects of type Port and/or Interface.
It is also possible to use the "Add Group" button and provide a group or a network device. The report will then display the average value for all objects in the group or from the network device.

maml:section.maml:title: Summary
maml:section.maml:para: This report displays the percentage of free memory on a network device over a period of time.
Description:
This report displays the amount of free memory, expressed as a percentage of total device memory, on the selected network device over a period of time.
Parameters:
Date/Time Selection: allows defining a time period for the report with relative or fixed dates
Business hours: Allows defining one business hours time range and the weekdays it applies to. If business hours are defined this report only reports within this range.
Histogram: Allows selecting the values used for the x-axis of the report.

maml:entry.maml:para: Daily by hours
For the chosen time range the x-axis will be one day.
Every x-axis unit is an hour.
To be able to show this histogram the values for the same hour are averaged.
Weekly by weekdays
One week is the time range of the x-axis.
Every unit is a weekday.
Monthly by days
One month is the x-axis time range.
Every unit is a numeric day of the month
Yearly by month
A year is the time range of the x-axis.
Every unit is a month.

maml:section.maml:para: Default is no (which is a historical chart)
3D Chart: Allows choosing if the report is shown in a flat or a 3D image.
Object List:
This report expects objects of type Memory.
It is also possible to use the "Add Group" button and provide a group or a network device. The report will then display the average value for all objects in the group or from the network device.

maml:section.maml:title: Summary
maml:section.maml:para: This report displays the processor utilization of a particular network device over a period of time.
Description:
The report shows processor utilization, expressed as a percentage, for the selected network device over a period of time.
Parameters:
Date/Time Selection: allows defining a time period for the report with relative or fixed dates
Business hours: Allows defining one business hours time range and the weekdays it applies to. If business hours are defined this report only reports within this range.
Histogram: Allows selecting the values used for the x-axis of the report.

maml:entry.maml:para: Daily by hours
For the chosen time range the x-axis will be one day.
Every x-axis unit is an hour.
To be able to show this histogram the values for the same hour are averaged.
Weekly by weekdays
One week is the time range of the x-axis.
Every unit is a weekday.
Monthly by days
One month is the x-axis time range.
Every unit is a numeric day of the month
Yearly by month
A year is the time range of the x-axis.
Every unit is a month.

maml:section.maml:para: Default is no (which is a historical chart)
3D Chart: Allows choosing if the report is shown in a flat or a 3D image.
Object List:
This report expects objects of type Processor.
It is also possible to use the "Add Group" button and provide a group or a network device. The report will then display the average value for all objects in the group or from the network device.

maml:section.maml:title: Summary
maml:section.maml:para: This report display the types of packets (unicast or nonunicast) that traverse the selected port or interface.
Description:

The report shows the number of packets of various types that traverse the interface. Depending on the specific interface, the following packet types will be shown: Unicast, Non-Unicast, Multicast, Broadcast.
Parameters:
Date/Time Selection: allows defining a time period for the report with relative or fixed dates
Business hours: Allows defining one business hours time range and the weekdays it applies to. If business hours are defined this report only reports within this range.
Histogram: Allows selecting the values used for the x-axis of the report.

maml:entry.maml:para: Daily by hours
For the chosen time range the x-axis will be one day.
Every x-axis unit is an hour.
To be able to show this histogram the values for the same hour are averaged.
Weekly by weekdays
One week is the time range of the x-axis.
Every unit is a weekday.
Monthly by days
One month is the x-axis time range.
Every unit is a numeric day of the month
Yearly by month
A year is the time range of the x-axis.
Every unit is a month.

maml:section.maml:para: Default is no (which is a historical chart)
3D Chart: Allows choosing if the report is shown in a flat or a 3D image.
Object List:
This report expects objects of type Port and/or Interface.
It is also possible to use the "Add Group" button and provide a group or a network device. The report will then display the average value for all objects in the group or from the network device.
